member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.MMS.PreambleInfo
member.summary: Helper class to store information about encodings with a preamble

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageHelper.GetBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string to an array of bytes

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageHelper.GetString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts a byte array to string

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageHelper.IsUnicode(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified text is Unicode.
member.returns: true if the specified text is Unicode; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageHelper.ReadAllText(System.String,System.Text.Encoding,System.Text.Encoding@)
member.summary: Read the contents of a text file as a string. Scan for a preamble first. If a preamble is found, the corresponding encoding is used. If no preamble is found, the supplied defaultEncoding is used.
member.param: The name of the file to read
The encoding to use if no preamble present
member.returns: The contents of the file as a string

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageHelper.DetectEncoding(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Detect the encoding in an array of bytes.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageHelper.DetectEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: Detect the encoding of a file. Reads just enough of the file to be able to detect a preamble.
member.param: The path name of the file
member.returns: The encoding detected, or null if no preamble found

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageHelper.ScanEncodings
member.summary: Loop over all available encodings and store those with a preamble in the _preambles list. The list is sorted by preamble length, longest preamble first. This prevents a short preamble 'masking' a longer one later in the list.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage
member.summary: The MultimediaMessage class represents a Multimedia Message.

member.summary: Check if the presentation part is available. return true if availale.

member.summary: Check if the Read-Reply field is available. return true if availale.

member.summary: Check if the Status field is available. return true if availale.

member.summary: Check if the message ID field is available. return true if availale.

member.summary: Check if the version field is available. return true if availale.

member.summary: Check if the date field is available. return true if availale.

member.summary: Check if the subject field is available. return true if availale.

member.summary: Check if the message class field is available. return true if availale.

member.summary: Check if the expiry date/time field is available. return true if availale.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.DeliveryTimeAvailable
member.summary: Check if the delivery date/time field is available. return true if availale.

member.summary: Check if the priority date/time field is available. return true if availale.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.ContentTypeAvailable
member.summary: Check if the content type field is available. return true if availale.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.ToAvailable
member.summary: Check if there is at least one receiver is specified. return true if at least one receiver is specified.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.BccAvailable
member.summary: Check if there is at least one BCC receiver is specified. return true if at least one BCC receiver is specified.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.CcAvailable
member.summary: Check if there is at least one CC receiver is specified. return true if at least one CC receiver is specified.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.MessageType
member.summary: Returns or sets the type of the message (Mandatory). Supported values are - MultimediaMessageConstants.MESSAGE_TYPE_M_SEND_REQ. - MultimediaMessageConstants.MESSAGE_TYPE_M_DELIVERY_IND.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.MessageId
member.summary: Retrieves the Message ID (Mandatory). Identifier of the message. From Send request, connects delivery report to sent message in MS.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.MessageStatus
member.summary: Retrieves the Message Status (Mandatory). The status of the message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.TransactionId
member.summary: Retrieves and Sets the transaction ID (Mandatory). It is a unique identifier for the message and it identifies the M-Send.req and the corresponding reply only.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.VersionAsString
member.summary: Retrieves the MMS version number as a String(Mandatory). return the version as a String. The only supported value are "1.0" and "1.1".

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.Version
member.summary: Retrieves and sets the MMS version number (Mandatory). The only supported value are MultimediaMessageConstants.MMS_VERSION_10

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.To
member.summary: Retrieve all the receivers of the Multimedia Message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.Cc
member.summary: Retrieve all the CC receivers of the Multimedia Message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.Bcc
member.summary: Retrieve all the BCC receivers of the Multimedia Message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.Date
member.summary: Retrieves the arrival time of the message at the MMS Proxy-Relay (Optional). MMS Proxy-Relay will generate this field when not supplied by terminal.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.Subject
member.summary: Retrieves the subject of the Multimedia Message (Optional).

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.MessageClass
member.summary: Retrieves and sets the message class of the Multimedia Message (Optional). Supported values are MESSAGE_CLASS_PERSONAL, MESSAGE_CLASS_ADVERTISEMENT, MESSAGE_CLASS_INFORMATIONAL, MESSAGE_CLASS_AUTO

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.ContentType
member.summary: Retrieves and sets the content type of the Multimedia Message (Mandatory). Supported values are CONTENT_TYPE_APPLICATION_MULTIPART_MIXED, CONTENT_TYPE_APPLICATION_MULTIPART_RELATED

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.NumContents
member.summary: Retrieves the number of contents of of the Multimedia Message (Mandatory).

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.PresentationId
member.summary: Retrieves the content ID referring to the presentation part. Sets the content ID of the content containing the presentation part of the Multimedia Message (Mandatory when the content type of the Multimedia Message is CONTENT_TYPE_APPLICATION_MULTIPART_RELATED).

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.MultipartRelatedType
member.summary: Retrieves the type of the presentation part. Sets the type of the presentation part.(Mandatory when the content type of the Multimedia Message is CONTENT_TYPE_APPLICATION_MULTIPART_RELATED).
member.value: The type of the multipart related. he standard for interoperability supports only the value: CONTENT_TYPE_APPLICATION_SMIL

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.Presentation
member.summary: Retrieves the content referring to the presentation part.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.Expiry
member.summary: Retrieves the expiry date of the message (Optional). Sets the length of time the message will be stored in the MMS Proxy-Relay or time to delete the message (Optional). This field can have two format, either absolute or interval depending on how it is set with the method setExpiryAbsolute().

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.ExpiryAbsolute
member.summary: Returns information about the format of the expiry date/time. Return true if the expiry date/time is absolute, false if it is intended as an interval. Sets the format of the expiry date/time. If true the expiry date is absolute, else is intended as an interval.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.DeliveryReport
member.summary: Retrieves the delivery-report flag (Optional). Return true if the user wants the delivery report. Specify whether the user wants a delivery report from each recipient (Optional). true if the user wants the delivery report.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.SenderVisibility
member.summary: Retrieves the sender-visibility flag (Optional). Return 0x80 if the user wants the sender visibility setting to Hide. 0x81 if the user wants the sender visibility setting to Show. Specify whether the user wants sender visibility (Optional). return 0x80 if the user wants the sender visibility setting to Hide. 0x81 if the user wants the sender visibility setting to Show.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.ReadReply
member.summary: Retrieves the read reply flag (Optional). return true if the user wants the read reply.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.DeliveryTime
member.summary: Retrieves the delivery date/time of the message (Optional). Sets the date/time of the desired delivery(Optional). Indicates the earliest possible delivery of the message to the recipient. This field can have two format, either absolute or interval depending on how it is set with the method setDeliveryTimeAbsolute().

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.DeliveryTimeAbsolute
member.summary: Returns information about the format of the delivery date/time. true if the delivery date/time is absolute, false if it is intended as an interval. Sets the format of the delivery date/time. true the delivery date/time is absolute, else is intended as an interval.
member.value: true if [delivery time absolute]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.Priority
member.summary: Retrieves or sets the priority of the message for the recipient (Optional). It can be one of the following the values: PRIORITY_LOW, PRIORITY_NORMAL, PRIORITY_HIGH

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.AddToAddress(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new receiver of the Multimedia Message. The message can have more than one receiver but at least one. param value is the string representing the address of the receiver. It has to be specified in the full format i.e.: +358990000005/TYPE=PLMN or joe@user.org or 1.2.3.4/TYPE=IPv4.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.AddCcAddress(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new receiver in the CC (Carbon Copy) field of the Multimedia Message. The message can have more than one receiver in the CC field. param value is the string representing the address of the CC receiver. It has to be specified in the full format i.e.: +358990000005/TYPE=PLMN or joe@user.org or 1.2.3.4/TYPE=IPv4.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.AddBccAddress(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new receiver in the BCC (Blind Carbon Copy) field of the Multimedia Message. The message can have more than one receiver in the BCC field.
member.param: value is the string representing the address of the BCC receiver. It has to be specified in the full format i.e.: +358990000005/TYPE=PLMN or joe@user.org or 1.2.3.4/TYPE=IPv4.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.ClearTo
member.summary: Clears all the receivers of the Multimedia Message.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.ClearCc
member.summary: Clears all the carbon copy receivers of the Multimedia Message.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.ClearBcc
member.summary: Clears all the blind carbon copy receivers of the Multimedia Message.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.GetFrom
member.summary: Retrieves the address of the message sender (Mandatory).

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.SetFrom(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the address of the message sender (Mandatory).
member.param: value is the string representing the address of the sender. It has to be specified in the full format i.e.: +358990000005/TYPE=PLMN or joe@user.org or 1.2.3.4/TYPE=IPv4..

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.AddContent(MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageContent)
member.summary: Adds a content to the message.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.GetContent(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the content having the specified id.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.GetContent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the content at the position index.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageAddress
member.summary: The MultimediaMessageAddress class represents a generic address for a sender or a receiver of a Multimedia Message.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageAddress.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new and empty multimedia address

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageAddress.#ctor(System.String,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Creates a MM address specifying the address and the type. param addr the string representing the address param type the type of the address.
It can be: AddressTypeUnknown, AddressTypePlmn, AddressTypeIPv4, AddressTypeIPv6, AddressTypeEmail

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageAddress.#ctor(MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageAddress)
member.summary: Creates a new MM address initialising it to the value passed as parameter.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageAddress.FullAddress
member.summary: Retrieves the MM address value in the full format. For example: +358990000066/TYPE=PLMN, joe@user.org, 1.2.3.4/TYPE=IPv4

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageAddress.Type
member.summary:
Retrieves the MM address type.
It can be: AddressTypeUnknown, AddressTypePlmn, AddressTypeIPv4, AddressTypeIPv6, AddressTypeEmail

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageAddress.SetAddress(System.String,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets MM address value specifying the address and the type. param addr the string representing the address param type the type of the address.
It can be: AddressTypeUnknown, AddressTypePlmn, AddressTypeIPv4, AddressTypeIPv6, AddressTypeEmail

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageAddress.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageConstants
member.summary: The MultimediaMessageConstants interface contains all the constants that are useful for the management of a Multimedia Message.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageContent
member.summary: The MultimediaMessageContent class represent a generic entry of a Multimedia Message.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageContent.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. Creates the object representing the content.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageContent.Type
member.summary: Retrieves the type of the entry. Examples are: text/plain, image/jpeg, image/gif, etc. return the type of the entry.
member.value: It's a valid content types. See WAP-203-WSP (WAP Forum) Examples are: text/plain, image/jpeg, image/gif, etc. You can use also some constants like: CONTENT_TYPE_TEXT_HTML, CONTENT_TYPE_TEXT_PLAIN, CONTENT_TYPE_TEXT_WML, CONTENT_TYPE_IMAGE_GIF, CONTENT_TYPE_IMAGE_JPEG, CONTENT_TYPE_IMAGE_WBMP, CONTENT_TYPE_APPLICATION_SMIL, etc. (these constants are defined in the interface MultimediaMessageConstants)

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageContent.ContentId
member.summary: Retrieves or sets the ID of the entry.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageContent.Length
member.summary: Retrieves the length in bytes of the entry.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageContent.ContentAsString
member.summary: Retrieves the String representing the entry.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageContent.SetContent(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset off.
member.param: the start offset in the data
the number of bytes to write

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageContent.GetContent
member.summary: Retrieves the array of byte representing the entry.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageContent.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageDecoder
member.summary: The MultimediaMessageDecoder class decodes an array of bytes representing a Multimedia Message (MM) according with the specification. The class can be used to obtain a MultimediaMessage object from which you can access to each field and content of the message

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageDecoder.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageDecoder.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageDecoder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageDecoder.SetMessage(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the buffer representing the Multimedia Message to be decoded.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageDecoder.SetMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the buffer representing the Multimedia Message to be decoded.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageDecoder.DecodeHeader
member.summary: Decodes the header of the Multimedia Message. After calling this method a MultimediaMessage object, containing just the information related to the header and without the contents, can be obtained by calling getMessage(). This method has to be called after setMessage(byte buf[).

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageDecoder.DecodeBody
member.summary: Decodes the body of the Multimedia Message. This method has to be called after the method decodeHeader()

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageDecoder.DecodeMessage
member.summary: Decodes the whole Multimedia Message. After calling this method a MultimediaMessage object, containing the information related to the header and the all contents, can be obtained by calling the method GetMessage(). This method has to be called after SetMessage(byte buf[).

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageDecoder.GetMessage
member.summary: Retrieves the MultimediaMessage object. This method has to be called after the calling of methods DecodeMessage() or DecodeHeader().
member.returns: An object representing the decoded Multimedia Message

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageDecoderException
member.summary: Thrown when an error occurs decoding a buffer representing a Multimedia Message

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageDecoderException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageEncoder
member.summary: The MultimediaMessageEncoder class encodes Multimedia Message object (MultimediaMessage) into an array of bytes according to the specification WAP-209-MMSEncapsulation (WAP Forum).

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageEncoder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageEncoder.SetMessage(MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage)
member.summary: Sets the Multimedia Message to be encoded.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageEncoder.GetMessage
member.summary: Retrieve the buffer of byte representing the encoded Multimedia Message. This method has to be called after the calling to encodeMessasge()
member.returns: the array of bytes representing the Multmedia Message

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageEncoder.EncodeContentType(System.String)
member.summary: Encode known content type assignments. List of the content type assignments can be found from WAP-203-WSP, Table 40 This version is compliant with Approved version 4-May-2000

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageEncoder.EncodeMessage
member.summary: Encodes the Multimedia Message set by calling SetMessage(MultimediaMessage msg)

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageEncoderException
member.summary: Thrown when an error occurs encoding a buffer representing a Multimedia Message

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageEncoderException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: The MultimediaMessageResponse class provides methods to get the response returned by the MMSC.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageResponse.HeadersList
member.summary: Returns an all the field (key) contained in the response header

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageResponse.GetResponseCode
member.summary: Gets the response code returned by the MMSC

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageResponse.GetResponseMessage
member.summary: Gets the response message returned by the MMSC

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageResponse.GetHeaderValue(System.String)
member.summary: This method returns an header value contained in the response returned by the MMSC param key the name of the header field

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageResponse.GetContentType
member.summary: This method returns the content type of the response

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageResponse.GetContentLength
member.summary: This method returns the content length of the response

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageResponse.GetContent
member.summary: This method returns the content of the response

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageSender
member.summary: The MultimediaMessageSender class provides methods to send Multimedia Messages to a predefined Multimedia Service Center (MMSC).

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageSender.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageSender.MMSCURL
member.summary: Gets the Multimedia Messaging Service Center address.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageSender.AddHeader(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add a new Header and Value in the HTTP Header

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageSender.Send(MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessage)
member.summary: Sends a Multimedia Message having a MMMessage object

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageSender.Send(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sends a Multimedia Message having an array of bytes representing the message.
member.param: the array of bytes representing the Multimedia Message.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageSender.Send(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends a Multimedia Message having an array of bytes representing the message and specifying the success code returned by the MMSC.
member.param: the array of bytes representing the Multimedia Message.
the success code returned by the MMSC. Generally it is 204.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.MMS.MultimediaMessageSenderException
member.summary: Thrown when an error occurs sending a Multimedia Message
